metadata.title: CVE-2023-52756 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: pwm:Fix double shift bug These enums are passed to set/test_bit(). Theset/test_bit() functions take a bit number instead of a shifted value.Passing a shifted value is a double shift bug like doing BIT(BIT(1)). Thedouble shift bug doesn't cause a problem here because we are only checking0 and 1 but if the value was 5 or above then it can lead to a bufferoverflow.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
